title: How to Make Pineapple Stuffing

steps.headline: Remove the peel & core from a pineapple, leaving the tender flesh.
steps.description: In a food processor, chop to similar size of chopped onion. Place the breadcrumbs in your mixing bowl and add all the pineapple and juice, stir well.

steps.headline: In the food processor chop macadamia nuts (if required), onions, garlic and chili in batches and each each to the bowl.
Season well with salt and pepper as well as the herbs and spices.
Add the egg and stir until combined.
steps.description: Add any extra ingredients at this stage. If it is still a little dry, add some cream to moisten it. Pineapple normally has adequate juice, but some times of year the fruit can be slightly dry.

steps.headline: Use as per normal in the chicken cavity, or wrap in baking paper like a sausage and cook separately.

text: Remove the peel & core from a pineapple, leaving the tender flesh. In a food processor, chop to similar size of chopped onion. Place the breadcrumbs in your mixing bowl and add all the pineapple and juice, stir well. In the food processor chop macadamia nuts (if required), onions, garlic and chili in batches and each each to the bowl.  Season well with salt and pepper as well as the herbs and spices.  Add the egg and stir until combined. Add any extra ingredients at this stage. If it is still a little dry, add some cream to moisten it. Pineapple normally has adequate juice, but some times of year the fruit can be slightly dry. Use as per normal in the chicken cavity, or wrap in baking paper like a sausage and cook separately.  Finished.
